sentences.english: She bid me take life easy, as the grass grows on the weirs.
sentences.chinese: 當青草在河岸滋長的時候，她囑咐我要輕鬆的去生活。

sentences.english: No sooner had the patient taken the drug than she vomited.
sentences.chinese: 風溼痛剛一減輕，醫生就囑咐病人停止服藥。

sentences.english: Without any reason often instructing that to climb a kid can not up.
sentences.chinese: 平白常囑咐那個攀登架小孩不能上。

sentences.english: Shirley stars push xiao LAN to one side, and charged her be careful.
sentences.chinese: 厲星晨將蕭嵐推到一邊，囑咐她當心。

sentences.english: But, before daub, must pass the reoccupy of the doctor after enjoining.
sentences.chinese: 但是，塗抹之前，必須經過醫生的囑咐後再用。

sentences.english: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.
sentences.chinese: 這些事你要囑咐她們，叫她們無可指責。

sentences.english: So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed.
sentences.chinese: 兵丁受了銀錢，就照所囑咐他們的去行。

sentences.english: It was too late for Teng De. With his last breath, he told his cousin to pass his wages to his mother.
sentences.chinese: 直到騰德快嚥氣時，仍囑咐堂弟把他的工錢交給母親。

sentences.english: What did Kerchak ask Tarzan to do before he died?
sentences.chinese: 克察克臨終前囑咐泰山做什麼？

sentences.english: The doctor enjoined a strict diet.
sentences.chinese: 醫生囑咐要嚴格規定飲食。

sentences.english: Hardly had the attenuation of rheumatic pains occurs when the doctor instructed the patient to stop medication.
sentences.chinese: 風溼痛剛一減輕，醫生就囑咐病人停止服藥。

sentences.english: The physician will discuss post-treatment care to avoid fungal re-infection.
sentences.chinese: 醫師還將囑咐治療後的護理，以避免真菌的再次感染。

sentences.english: Just trust, and trust, and trust, until His will you know.
sentences.chinese: 只有信主，深信祂，直到你明白祂的旨意和囑咐。

sentences.english: Tian aide by Xu Dongmei charge came to the sea, and brought a letter.
sentences.chinese: 田副官按照許冬梅的囑咐來到了通海，並帶來了信件。

sentences.english: And charged them that they should not make him known
sentences.chinese: 又囑咐他們，不要給他傳名。

sentences.english: She bid me take love easy, as the leaves grow on the tree;
sentences.chinese: 她囑咐我要愛得輕鬆，就象新葉在枝椏萌芽。

definition: to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
to warn/to urge/to exhort/to give instructions carefully and insistently
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
